message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.SI 

The paper proposes a semi-supervised clustering method that models data with Gaussian distributions and retrieves clusters based on partial labeling provided by the user. This method combines ideas from cross-entropy clustering and the information bottleneck method. The paper focuses on machine learning and data analysis, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with clustering, which is a common topic in the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The paper also mentions natural language processing, which is a topic in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The paper's use of Gaussian distributions and its application to image segmentation suggest that it may also belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on clustering and information theory suggests that it may also belong to the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category.
